stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on polishing the new factory-themed course: integrating missing textures, tweaking a bomb-themed boss, and experimenting with dynamic lighting and alarm SFX. Frequent back-and-forth with Biobak about stage assets and a few tooling issues with Lilaa surfaced. Kaze also laid out the public demo release cadence tied to upcoming YouTube videos.
level: Factory course (working name, sometimes called "course 15" earlier)

development_findings.summary: Textures for factorycanon.blend were missing; Kaze pinged Biobak to supply them immediately.
Kaze added a looping alarm sound to factory cannons, choosing a positional sound-effect implementation so volume pans with camera distance.
development_findings.quote: It makes sense as a sound effect… it's dynamically positioned.

development_findings.summary: King Bob-omb rework: boss now turns orange on hit, dies in one hit, and despawns permanently once the Bomb Cap is unlocked.
development_findings.quote: The idea is that he doesn't spawn if you have the bomb cap unlocked, and he dies permanently.

development_findings.summary: A switch-activated wall now rises in the boss arena; the player must later break it, adding a puzzle layer.
development_findings.quote: The wall comes up as soon as you press the switch… in the end, you're just gonna have to break the wall.

development_findings.summary: Added an item box in the post-boss room to improve flow; Kaze noted earlier playtest confusion.
development_findings.quote: Wait, there's no box in the room after?… I absolutely have to add one.

development_findings.summary: Stage can be beaten forward and backward; obstacles were deliberately designed to work both ways for replayability.
development_findings.quote: I beat it backwards earlier and I think it's really fun… it changes the vibe a lot.

development_findings.summary: Camera switches are currently red; Kaze flagged this for a later visual-identity pass.
development_findings.quote: The camp switches… the color is red. We have four different ones. We need to fix separately.

development_findings.summary: Bombable wall will use a grayscale texture multiplied by primitive colour to inherit local room lighting; Kaze plans cracks and a two-cycle animation.
development_findings.quote: We can get a quadruple multiplication going… primitive colour can be the lighting in the room.

development_findings.summary: Build currently compiles clean; Kaze shaved a microsecond via minor code optimisations but deemed it ‘silly’ if readability suffers.
development_findings.quote: Not even half a microsecond… it makes the code harder to read.

development_findings.summary: Public demo content is finished; release is gated by three videos (one Saturday, one from editor, Missing Link video 14 Dec). ETA late December (~28 Dec).
development_findings.quote: The new demo will be released whenever the video for it is ready… might be December 28th or something.

development_findings.summary: Once Kaze’s tasks finish ahead of Biobak’s re-textures, he plans to focus on VFX/SFX polish.
development_findings.quote: Likely what I'll do in that time is improve the visual fidelity of things… adding VFX, SFX, stuff like that.

context_findings.summary: Kaze views Twitter monetisation as trivial to game and partly ties release cadence to social-media videos.
context_findings.quote: I go to one famous page and post ‘I have Twitter Blue’ and get 300,000 views… it does pay for itself.

context_findings.summary: He prides himself on an ‘infinite ego,’ rarely taking insults personally.
context_findings.quote: I guess that's one of the benefits of having literally infinite ego.

context_findings.summary: No mobile phone plan; claims he rarely goes outside and uses wife’s phone if needed.
context_findings.quote: People are always surprised… I don't go outside. What do I need a phone for?

context_findings.summary: Stream ended early due to off-stream obligations; indicates time-management pressure.
context_findings.quote: I have some stuff to do after the stream as well… today's stream is ending a little earlier than usual.

context_findings.summary: Briefly addressed YouTuber ‘Skill in your’ drama over a video accusing him of wrongdoing, but treated it humorously.
context_findings.quote: He released a video called ‘Kaze Emanuar maybe a criminal’… then renamed it.

biobak.summary: Responsible for factory textures, wall gears, bombable wall asset, and upcoming level reworks; Kaze waits on his decision for the next level.
biobak.quote: Biobak, do you know which level you want to do next? This is going to affect my decisions in life.

biobak.summary: Removed certain wall gears; Kaze queried if that was intentional.
biobak.quote: You removed them entirely… you wanted them gone?

key_stories.title: The Missing Factory Textures
key_stories.summary: Early in the session Kaze discovered that the factory cannon scene lacked textures. He immediately paged Biobak, who supplied the files on stream.
key_stories.challenge: Factorycanon.blend loaded with placeholder or absent textures.
key_stories.process: Kaze halted progress, pinged Biobak, verified incoming files, and hot-reloaded the stage.
key_stories.outcome: Textures restored; level presentation now matches art direction.
key_stories.key_quote: Biobak, there's textures missing in the factorycanon.blend file.

key_stories.title: Reinventing King Bob-omb
key_stories.summary: Kaze overhauled the iconic boss for the Bomb Cap stage, shortening the fight and adding a one-hit kill with dramatic colour feedback.
key_stories.challenge: Original multi-hit version felt unfun and redundant once the cap was unlocked.
key_stories.process: Re-wrote death logic, added primitive-colour flash to orange, tied spawn condition to cap status.
key_stories.outcome: Stream audience approved; boss flows faster and doesn't respawn.
key_stories.key_quote: I don't want to make him die in one hit… wait, actually, let's just reduce it to one.

key_stories.title: Demo Release Bottleneck
key_stories.summary: Although gameplay content is finished, Kaze is holding the public demo until prerequisite YouTube content drops to maximise exposure.
key_stories.challenge: Synchronising marketing content with development milestones.
key_stories.process: Scheduled three videos (Saturday teaser, editor video, Missing Link on 14 Dec) before green-lighting demo.
key_stories.outcome: Tentative release date of 28 Dec; community kept in suspense.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm basically done with it, but there is one video… after that I can release the demo.

key_stories.title: Bidirectional Stage Design
key_stories.summary: Kaze showcased a new level intended to be played both forward and backward, doubling replay value without extra geometry.
key_stories.challenge: Creating fresh experiences in limited ROM space.
key_stories.process: Arranged obstacles so they ‘work for you’ in reverse; performed live backwards run to test.
key_stories.outcome: Proof of concept succeeded; Kaze plans to keep the mechanic.
key_stories.key_quote: It changes the vibe a lot—it's interesting to experience.
